body:
I have recently turned back to Christianity after many years as a hardcore atheist. I started going to church with a good family I admire and I started listening to Christian podcasts. I walked away for a long time, but I really feel like I'm hearing His voice clearly for the first time in my life. I'm actively letting him in everyday, but I still struggle with it. I would appreciate anyone praying for me to get over myself and fully know Christ. 

Also are there any preachers you guys could recommend to me?
body_html:
I have recently turned back to Christianity after many years as a hardcore atheist. I started going to church with a good family I admire and I started listening to Christian podcasts. I walked away for a long time, but I really feel like I'm hearing His voice clearly for the first time in my life. I'm actively letting him in everyday, but I still struggle with it. I would appreciate anyone praying for me to get over myself and fully know Christ.

Also are there any preachers you guys could recommend to me?

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
> listening to Christian podcasts

Beware, those are usually very dangerous and just a disguise for politics. The protestant movement has become almost as centralized as the catholic church and it's full of lies.

> Also are there any preachers you guys could recommend to me?

Do not call anyone "pastor" for we only have one teacher, and we are all siblings. And don't call anyone on earth "father" for we only have one father, the heavenly one. And don't call anyone a leader, because we only have one leader.
body_html:
listening to Christian podcasts

Beware, those are usually very dangerous and just a disguise for politics. The protestant movement has become almost as centralized as the catholic church and it's full of lies.

Also are there any preachers you guys could recommend to me?

Do not call anyone "pastor" for we only have one teacher, and we are all siblings. And don't call anyone on earth "father" for we only have one father, the heavenly one. And don't call anyone a leader, because we only have one leader.

body: Jesus. Try reading a new testament red letter edition. Jesus response is what holds truth and makes the rest of the bible more understandable

body:
"NNOOOOOOOOOOOOOO everyone else in the Bible is more important than Jesus, you can't do that!"

People won't admit it but that's their attitude these days.
body_html:
"NNOOOOOOOOOOOOOO everyone else in the Bible is more important than Jesus, you can't do that!"

People won't admit it but that's their attitude these days.
